data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Your foot should always be facing forward. Your direction of travel is forward and your steps are backward. So, the answer is yes.

If you turn around right and turn around left you are in the same place that you started. So, the answer is Yes.

Any given step is not a series of two steps. It can be taken as many as needed. So, the answer is No.

Turn left again, then turn left. Turn around, then take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

You always face forward and take an extra step after you have taken 6 steps. When you take 4 steps you are 6 steps in front of you and you are facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take a step backward, you will be facing the first step. You can never take a step forward. So, the answer is No.

Since always facing forward is always the best direction to begin a story, facing forward is the best starting point for all stories. If you get 6 steps backward, you will have 6 steps to go back, 8 steps to go right, 1 step backward and 5 steps to go left. If you get 8 steps right, you will have 8 steps to go back, 5 steps to go left, 1 step backward and 5 steps to go left. If you take 2 steps left, you will be taken 2 steps left. So, the answer is no.

Take 4 steps right. There are 8 steps left to the starting point. There are 9 steps left to take the first time. The starting point is in the center of the circle. The starting point is in the middle of the circle with 4 steps on the right. So, the answer is No.

To go backward or forward, face forward. If you always face forward, you walk away from being right. In the example, to go forward, you first walk 3 steps left, 3 steps right, then 2 steps right and 3 steps left. It is 4 steps to go backward or forward. Final answer: yes.
